title: The seven programming ur-languages (2021)
dot:
digraph UrLanguages{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgrey]; UrLanguages[label="The Seven Programming Ur-Languages", shape=ellipse, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];ALGOL[label="ALGOL
Characteristics: Sequences, Assignments, Loops
Examples: C, C++, Java, Python
History: Oldest, structured programming"];Lisp[label="Lisp
Characteristics: Prefix expressions, Macros
Examples: Common Lisp, Scheme, Clojure
History: Second oldest, AI research"];ML[label="ML
Characteristics: Functional, Type system
Examples: OCaml, Haskell
History: Metalanguage for theorem proving"];Self[label="Self
Characteristics: Object-oriented, Message passing
Examples: Smalltalk, JavaScript
History: Xerox Parc, HotSpot JIT"];Forth[label="Forth
Characteristics: Stack-based, Reverse Polish
Examples: Forth, PostScript
History: Embedded systems, Radio telescopes"];APL[label="APL
Characteristics: Array operations, Terse
Examples: APL, J, K
History: Heavy calculations, Financial settings"];Prolog[label="Prolog
Characteristics: Logic, Facts and Queries
Examples: Prolog, Mercury
History: Logic programming, Fifth gen project"];UrLanguages->ALGOL;UrLanguages->Lisp;UrLanguages->ML;UrLanguages->Self;UrLanguages->Forth;UrLanguages->APL;UrLanguages->Prolog;}
